reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Charming room, tastefully furnished and comfortable. Bathroom could do with a bit of refurbishment. Concerned that the on site pizzeria was the only place to eat without a 15/20 minute walk or a drive. However, it also did grills and lovely galettes. Thought we might have a post dinner drink in the bar but it shut up at 9pm!
reviews.title: Lovely setting

reviews.text: We arrived about 3pm to find the hotel locked up - the reception only opened at 5pm. However, we went to the local hypermarket to buy (bizarrely - British) beer and had a nose around the village. The manager did turn up at 5pm so all was well.
reviews.title: Refreshingly Excellent!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is set up like a motel - you park outside the room. Its a fair walk to the local village, and I was a bit concerned what we'd do (except eat at the pizza place opposite). However, I spotted in the hotel information pack that there is a disused railway line nearby (1 km up the road) and the owner directed us to it. It was great - going through lovely woodlands. We loved it . Although the hotel claims to have bikes for guests' use, they weren't available so you should ring ahead if you're interested in doing this - or take your own bikes.
reviews.title: Lovely Bolt Hole

reviews.text: The room was a bit dark, with one window at one end. The bathroom was a bit 70s-ish with unusual artwork on the walls. But the beds were clean, comfortable and the hotel was quiet.
reviews.title: Cozy, charming, beautiful.
